It is a cool ship but not really needed by the US Navy. It is weak in firepower as a sea going frigate and too large and wide for river patrol. Upscale it to light cruiser size, give it some very light and thin armor, and outfit it with everything an Arleigh Burke class destroyer has. Then you can have another contender to replace the current destroyers. Let it keep some of the above the waterline shaping of the Zumwalt class as well as the 6" gun and radar. Then you will have an advanced light cruiser more capable and faster than the current destroyers.

The Ticonderoga class guided missile cruisers can likewise be replaced with higher capability battle cruisers with some similar features but more focused on the air defense role. The new battle cruisers could have a monohull or also be a trimaran. If a trimaran is chosen the ama can help to protect part of the center hull but it would probably be less suited for icy waters. They should be modestly armored and have nuclear propulsion. They should have several 6 inch guns in one or two turrets and a lot of missiles. Also a very large powerful radar with the best air defense missiles available such as SkyCeptor plus ESSM and RAM for shorter ranges.

Trimaran  FTW

One interesting thing, when it's going at high speed, the bow wave stays inside the outriggers, and the outriggers are able to smooth the bow wave out somewhat which makes it more efficient, and helps it go fast.

Also because of the shape, the outriggers don't produce much external bow wave at all, and the internal one is used to cancel the wave from the center hull.
